title: Jinx Cosplay
body:
Cosplay by Ayriath! (www.facebook.com/Ayriath)
Photo by Ngo Photographt! (www.facebook.com/NgoPhotography)

The weapons were fully 3D printed and took me about four-five months to complete! The gradient work on Fishbones was done by hand, including the detail painting, and PowPow was airbrushed with automotive paint. 

Poor Zap can't be seen, but he's there! I'll have more pictures with him showing him. He lights up beautifully-I actually had to rewire him twice because the first time, the wires were too large to fit inside his barrel. 

Next League projects are: Pool Party Leona and Star Guardian Lux. 
I've also already done Spellthief Lux!

Follow my work if you wish! I'll post streaming/posting prop and costume creation soon if anyone ever wanted to get into the world of cosplaying. :)

Edit: Photo of Zap now available! Also 3D printed. Wish it was darker so you could see it light up, but that's sometimes hard to transition into photos. 

http://i.imgur.com/FwkH4Bp.jpg

Bonus fishbones love:

http://i.imgur.com/StwKarh.jpg

replies.body: 10/10 would f... feed.
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/018/083/image.jpg

Holy shit, that's some of the best jinx cosplay I've seen.  Great job. 

For your next project I think It would be cool if you took pictures of the whole process along the way and maybe made a video or something explaining the finer points and difficulties to creating the costumes.  Idk maybe its just me but as much as I like seeing the finished product, I always enjoy watching it being built and all of the effort put in to the project.

Also not as relevant but it needs to be said anyways, very hot.

Thank you!

I was taking photos and putting them in a WIP album up until the final moments because I was on a real crunch time for PAX East!

I'll make sure to document how to 3D model, sanding and painting techniques, wiring, etc. when I work on Star Guardian Lux, since I'll be 3D printing pieces for her staff as well as vacuum forming the star and doing the lighting. 

Thanks for the reminder!

Anyone commenting on the physique of the cosplayer or saying that she doesn't have the proper 'body type' should be downvoted, ingored, and payed no mind. They obviously have no understanding or appreciation for cosplay as an art form. This is a flawless recreation of the character.

B..b..but she has boobies and jinx don't 

alright you can downvote me now :D
love how by sayin this you imply you put some thought into it XD

"Damn, girl. You can blow me any time."
"Okay" [Shoots Rocket]
"THAT'S NOT WHAT I MEANT!" [KABOOM]
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}


(But seriously, that cos-play is hot)
That made me smile, And it's 4 AM, The point is I never smile I don't know I'm tired

Very nice! Man those guns look great. I give it a 5/7.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I understood that reference. >:D

Wow, on the thumbnail I thought that was a drawing for inspiration, not the actually outfit. Bravo.

Where did you get access to a 3D printer?

A friend of mine lives about two hours away from me and he does prop commissions! After he made my Weiss sword from RWBY for me because I was on a crunch, I asked him if he would be willing to teach me how to 3D model and 3D print, including assembling and painting. 

Dude was super sweet and basically let me come and use his printer to print the files we made.

It was printed on a Rostock MAX and he spins his own plastic filament so it's actually decently cheaper to make!

> [{quoted}](name=Knalxz,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=Vb5wYZ2W,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-27T05:13:54.217+0000)
>
> Wow, on the thumbnail I thought that was a drawing for inspiration, not the actually outfit. Bravo.
> 
> Where did you get access to a 3D printer?

you can get a 3d printer for like $500 now they aren't that expensive anymore

Yeah, but the cheaper ones tend to be more crummy, break more often, and have such small printing dimensions that the majority of your builds (If you're not making small trinkets) will need to be chopped into A BUNCH of pieces, and sometimes if you're building things with bigger single pieces like Fishbones is, you create a problem with having to fill seams and weakness at the seam. 

The one I used is: http://www.seemecnc.com/products/rostock-max-complete-kit

$1000 for the complete kit, but it's got great dimensions and the kit comes with the upgraded parts so the nozzle won't catch like the old versions did.

> [{quoted}](name=Ayriath,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=Vb5wYZ2W,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2016-04-27T17:26:02.396+0000)
>
> Yeah, but the cheaper ones tend to be more crummy, break more often, and have such small printing dimensions that the majority of your builds (If you're not making small trinkets) will need to be chopped into A BUNCH of pieces, and sometimes if you're building things with bigger single pieces like Fishbones is, you create a problem with having to fill seams and weakness at the seam. 
> 
> The one I used is: http://www.seemecnc.com/products/rostock-max-complete-kit
> 
> $1000 for the complete kit, but it's got great dimensions and the kit comes with the upgraded parts so the nozzle won't catch like the old versions did.


how many pieces did it takes to build the guns? 
and how much material did you use to make both guns?

Pow Pow was printed in I want to say...20 pieces or so because the handle pieces/nozzle parts/grates for the back piece were printed separately. All the big bulky pieces were printed on their own without having to split them. The middle barrel was printed as is, the bottom 'resting' part of the gun was one piece, the back piece was only sliced in two because there needed to be a flat surface to print. 
Fishbones was much less than that. I want to say, not including the fines, the main body was split into two/three major pieces that slotted into one another. 

The major help was being able to print all the bulky pieces as just one piece instead of having to cut them in half. 

And I think we went through about 4-5 spools? I forget. Around $100 worth of filament (Which is a cheaper estimation than normal because my friend spins his own plastic filament instead of buying it).

> [{quoted}](name=Ayriath,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=Vb5wYZ2W,comment-id=00030001000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-27T18:37:38.571+0000)
>
> Pow Pow was printed in I want to say...20 pieces or so because the handle pieces/nozzle parts/grates for the back piece were printed separately. All the big bulky pieces were printed on their own without having to split them. The middle barrel was printed as is, the bottom 'resting' part of the gun was one piece, the back piece was only sliced in two because there needed to be a flat surface to print. 
> Fishbones was much less than that. I want to say, not including the fines, the main body was split into two/three major pieces that slotted into one another. 
> 
> The major help was being able to print all the bulky pieces as just one piece instead of having to cut them in half. 
> 
> And I think we went through about 4-5 spools? I forget. Around $100 worth of filament (Which is a cheaper estimation than normal because my friend spins his own plastic filament instead of buying it).


and how did you make this? Was there a site you downloaded the file of the 2 guns from then printed it?

Only FIshbones was printed using a pre-made model due to time constraints. 
Zap and FIshbones were 3D modeled on Rhino3D and sliced for printing!

The file used for Fishbones was found at: http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1051281

So you're only looking at her physical figure and not all the countless micro-details, wigs, makeup, and the fact that she made all of this herself? Really?

Do you even know what cosplay is? She got it fine anyways, she looks A LOT like her. While I can be frank and say yes, her bust is larger then Jinx's in game, who really cares? its still a great cosplay, and the costume is done exceptionally well, as are the weapons. You don't gotta be so critical man, there probably was a nicer way for you to say, "He, it all looks great but I can't help but feel your bust and body type is slightly larger then Jinx's!" (again, who really cares, great cosplay either way)

Idk, that seems better to me then the way you put it.
You misunderstand. She has boobs. Jinx does not have boobs. I would not cosplay as Sona because I do not have boobs. It's a simple as that.

Well, I'm sorry that you let the excitement and love of cosplay and a character be ruined by the idea that your body doesn't match hers, despite all the happiness and love that comes out of making a costume.
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kkEf-wZwk64/hqdefault.jpg
Lol she can't cosplay Jinx because she isn't pale white and ultra-skinny? That's not what it's about, personally I think she nailed the look.

http://media.tumblr.com/tumblr_ltw82fIrXi1qafrh6.gif
https://49.media.tumblr.com/dbcddcb3fe25a4c6926564bcfe3b58b9/tumblr_np5qt5FUlY1sv5dnfo1_500.gif
When the boobs are big just right

I really like this cosplay and it looks like you had a ton of fun with it ^_^ the only issue I can see is that your expression looks rather cute-sy and absent minded rather than the thrilled giddiness Jinx typically shows, that and fish-bones looks a little....off, I don't really know how to describe it so my apologies. Although with it being hand-painted it looks ASTOUNDINGLY good, the rest of the cosplay looks like it popped right out of the game!

But the most important part is that you had fun, right?

This is sadly just the first 'preview' photo from the photographer, but there will be more with crazier expressions, I promise! ;A;

I'm honestly surprised they even caught this even mildly 'sassy' face with the fact we were being rained on in Boston. I figured they all looked absent minded because it was cold and wet.

Okie dokie ^_^ As a photographer myself I get frustrated at the weather quite often, JANNA STOP IT PLS XD

If this is just a preview I'm excited to see the rest of the cosplay! Keep being the awesome you! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Photogs. <3 <3
Best cosplay I've seen since February, From anyone XD, Good job on this It's amazing!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}
